name: Jianli Pan
content: Jianli Pan's Homepage Jianli Pan Ph.D., Associate Professor Department of Information Sciences and Technology College of Engineering and Computing George Mason University Address: 437 Research Hall, Mail Stop 5B5, 4400 University Dr., Fairfax, VA 22030 Email: jpan22@gmu.edu Phone: (703)-993-7285 Research Profile: Google Scholar Profile Home  |  Projects  |  Publications  |  Teaching  |  Awards  |  News I am currently looking for self-motivated students or scholars to work on topics such as AI and Machine Learning, Intelligent IoT/Edge Systems, and Cybersecurity. Please contact jpan22@gmu.edu. Biography: I am currently a tenured associate professor in the Department of Information Sciences and Technology at George Mason University (GMU). I earned my Ph.D. degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering of Washington University in Saint Louis. My Ph.D. advisor was Prof. Raj Jain. Before that, I graduated from Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications (BUPT), China. My research interests broadly cover: AI and Machine Learning, Intelligent IoT/Edge Systems, and Cybersecurity. I am particularly interested in solving emerging important problems at the intersections of the above-mentioned areas, in addressing the real-world grand challenges that our society faces, and in enabling intelligent and secure systems for future homes, campuses, factories, communities, and cities.
